head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 19/6/70 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that the Audit-Commissioners have asked me to adjust the advance, which was made for gravelling at Toorak in 1867, a duty whi...

div.p: W70/6809, unit 467, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Trans. Angela. To proof.
Melbourne bot. Garden

I have the honor to inform you, that the Audit-Commissioners have asked me to adjust the advance, which was made for gravelling at Toorak in 1867, a duty which I then undertook on behalf of the Lands Department. The expenditure is in reality long ago adjusted, but the adjustment has deeming by you yet to pass through some official form. For this the papers, which were — as far as I am aware — transmitted to the Department of the hon. the Chief Secretary, are needed, and I beg therefore to enquire, whether these documents are still accessible at your office, and could be sent to me, with a view of fulfilling the requirements of the audit commissioners.

div.p: I have the honor to be,
